Events that occurred on 1 November.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1897 - Novelist, poet and letter-receiver Naomi Mitchison is born.
1910 - J.R.R. Tolkien visits Cambridge for a football match.
1922 - Actor John Westbrook is born.
1944 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 88a.
1963 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 250.
1964 - Actor Daran Norris is born.
1966 - J.R.R. Tolkien conducts an interview with Richard Plotz.
1970 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 317.
1971 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 330.
1972 - J.R.R. Tolkien's desk is sold at Sotheby's.
1975 - Cartoonist Lise Myhre is born.
1977 - Ted Johnstone dies.
1979 - Pictures by J.R.R. Tolkien is first published in the UK.
1990 – Tolklang is founded by Julian C. Bradfield.
1999 - George Allen and Unwin: A Remembrancer is published.
2008 - The Tolkien Name in History is published.
2010 - Mereth Aderthad XVI, or "EstelCon" of the Spanish Tolkien Society in Valenica, Spain.
2011 - The Lord of the Rings: War in the North is released in North America.
2012 - The J.R.R. Tolkien Miscellany is published.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
F.A. 495:
Tuor, guided by Voronwë, travels to Gondolin in order to deliver Ulmo's message to Turgon.
T.A. 3018:
Frodo and Samwise rest in Rivendell and prepare for their quest to destroy the One Ring.
T.A. 3019:
At their arrival in the Shire, the four Hobbits are arrested at Frogmorton[1] by the First Eastfarthing Troop and taken to the Shirriff-house.

content.title: References
content.content: ↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings, Appendix B, "The Chief Days from the Fall of Barad-dûr to the End of the Third Age"
